A

act() - Method in class Game
When the game begins, this method will automatically be executed every millisecond This may be used as a control method for checking user input and collision between any game objects
act() - Method in class GameObject
This method should be implemented to provide a behavior for this object.
act() - Method in class Player
Moves the player.
act() - Method in class Portal
Acts by doing nothing.
act() - Method in class PortalGame
Fill in this method with code that tells the playing field what to do from one moment to the next
act() - Method in class PortalTrail
A PortalTrail acts by going in a straight line through the (destinationX, destinationY) point.
act() - Method in class Potato
A potato acts by doing nothing.
act() - Method in class Wall
Default act method.
add(GameObject) - Method in class Game
Adds a game object to the screen Any added objects will have their act method called every millisecond

canPortal() - Method in class HardWall
Cannot portal.
canPortal() - Method in interface Portalable
Returns whether or not the wall can Portal.
canPortal() - Method in class RedWall
Since a RedWall will reset the player, a Portal cannot be in contact with a RedWall (this would reset you).
canPortal() - Method in class Wall
Implementing the Portalable interface.
collides(GameObject) - Method in class GameObject
Returns true if this object collides with another GameObject

G

Game - Class in <Unnamed>
An abstract Game class which can be built into Pong.

The default controls are for "Player 1" to move left and right with the 'Z' and 'X' keys, and "Playr 2" to move left and right with the 'N' and 'M' keys.

Before the Game begins, the setup method is executed.
Game() - Constructor for class Game
The default constructor for the game.
Game._WinDialog - Class in <Unnamed>
 
Game._WinDialog(JFrame, String) - Constructor for class Game._WinDialog
 
GameObject - Class in <Unnamed>
An abstract class for an object which can be added to an instance of Game

The act method can be implemented to provide a behavior for the object, and will be called every millisecond automatically by a Game it has been added to.
GameObject() - Constructor for class GameObject
 
getColor() - Method in class GameObject
 
getFieldHeight() - Method in class Game
Gets the pixel height of the visible playing field
getFieldWidth() - Method in class Game
Gets the pixel width of the visible playing field

Returns the FileInputStream

getWalls() - Method in class PortalGame
Returns the walls needed for a level.
getX() - Method in class GameObject
Gets the x component of the coordinate of the upper left corner of this object The coordinate is relative to the playing field, with 0 being the far left of the field, and positive values moving toward the right of the field
getXVelocity() - Method in class Player
Gets the x-velocity movement at the current moment.
getY() - Method in class GameObject
Gets the y component of the coordinate of the upper left corner of this object The coordinate is relative to the playing field, with 0 being the top of the field, and positive values moving toward the bottom of the field

This wall will end the level.

MusicPlayer - Class in <Unnamed>
MusicPlayer lets you play an MP3 file in the background while using your application.
It extends Thread to do this.
Some methods will throw IllegalStateExceptions and other errors if the files are not correct.
MusicPlayer() - Constructor for class MusicPlayer
Sets up the music player with the default bgmusic.mp3 file
MusicPlayer(String) - Constructor for class MusicPlayer
Sets up the music player with the specified file name.
MusicPlayer(FileInputStream) - Constructor for class MusicPlayer
Sets up the Music Player with the specified file input stream.

Player - Class in <Unnamed>
Player.java
The Player class maintains the player's movement and her location and size.
Player() - Constructor for class Player
Constructs a Player with the default width, height and Orange color.
Portal - Class in <Unnamed>
A Portal is a GameObject which teleports a user from one Portal to another.
In PortalGame (and subclasses), when the Player collides with a Portal, they exit the other.
Portal(Color, int, int) - Constructor for class Portal
Constructs a Portal.
Portalable - Interface in <Unnamed>
An interface that determines that whether an object can have a portal placed on it.
PortalGame - Class in <Unnamed>
The driver for Portal.
PortalGame() - Constructor for class PortalGame

Potato - Class in <Unnamed>
A Potato is a scoring object which determines the percentage of completion.

setup() - Method in class Game
When implemented, this will allow the programmer to initialize the game before it begins running Adding objects to the game and setting their initial positions should be done here.
setup() - Method in class PortalGame
Fill in this method with code that tells the game what to do before actual play begins Sets up the Portal Playing Field.
setX(int) - Method in class GameObject
Sets the x (horizontal) position of this object Setting the x position will not affect the y position
setXVelocity(int) - Method in class Player
Sets the x-velocity movement.
setY(int) - Method in class GameObject
Sets the y (vertical) position of this object Setting the y position will not affect the x position

Returns whether or not the slope is less than zero.

stopGame() - Method in class Game
Stops updates to the game This can act like a "pause" method
